page.title: 15THE LOCAL BLACKSMITH
page.content: I started my career as a self-employed blacksmith in the spring of 1947.The work of the farm horse was declining, as tractors took over, and I spent my first few years making small farm implements and rimming cart wheels. By the end of the decade the process of converting and adapting horse drawn machinery to tractor work had started, machines such as the hay cutter, spreader,ploughs,ridgers, and other implements. At first I did not possess an electric welding machine, so all my work had to be done on the forge fire. I later bought a power drill,iron sawing machine,grinders and other machinery for my own special needs.My work has changed and increased a great deal. Today ornamental work is on the increase and I am as busy as ever making ornamental gates,railings,doors etc. for local craftsmen.{MR.W.DAVIES
